ca.gedge.opgraph
Class Processor

java.lang.Object
  ca.gedge.opgraph.Processor

public class Processor
extends Object

A processing context for OpGraph instances. A fine level of control is given, allowing one to step through an operable graph in various ways.

Constructor Summary
Processor(OpGraph graph)
          Constructs a processing context for a given graph.
Processor(OpGraph graph, CustomProcessing.CustomProcessor customProcessor, OpContext context)
          Constructs a processing context for a given graph.
Processor(OpGraph graph, OpContext context)
          Constructs a processing context for a given graph and a preset operating context.

Constructor Detail

Processor

public Processor(OpGraph graph)
Constructs a processing context for a given graph.

Parameters:
graph - the graph
Throws:
NullPointerException - if the specified graph is null

Processor

public Processor(OpGraph graph,
                 OpContext context)
Constructs a processing context for a given graph and a preset operating context.

Parameters:
graph - the graph
context - the initial global context, or null to use an empty global context
Throws:
NullPointerException - if the specified graph is null

Processor

public Processor(OpGraph graph,
                 CustomProcessing.CustomProcessor customProcessor,
                 OpContext context)
Constructs a processing context for a given graph.

Parameters:
graph - the graph
customProcessor - a custom processing instance, or null if no custom processing required
context - the initial global context, or null to use an empty global context
Throws:
NullPointerException - if the specified graph is null
Method Detail

reset

public void reset()
Resets this context so that further processing will start from the beginning.

reset

public void reset(OpContext context)
Resets this context so that further processing will start from the beginning.

Parameters:
context - the global context that should be used for processing, or null if a default one should be used

getGraph

public OpGraph getGraph()
Gets the graph that is currently being operated on.

Returns:
the graph

getGraphOfContext

public OpGraph getGraphOfContext()
Gets the graph this processing context is operating on.

Returns:
the graph

getContext

public OpContext getContext()
Gets the context used for processing.

Returns:
the context

getError

public ProcessingException getError()
Gets the error that was thrown since the last reset.

Returns:
the error, or null if no error was thrown

getErrorContext

public Processor getErrorContext()
Gets the context that spawned the error returned by getError().

Returns:
the error-spawning context, or null if getError() == null

getCurrentNode

public OpNode getCurrentNode()
Gets the node that was most recently processed.

Returns:
the node, or null if processing has yet to start or no more nodes to process.

getCurrentNodeOfContext

public OpNode getCurrentNodeOfContext()
Gets the node that was most recently processed in this context.

Returns:
the node, or null if processing has yet to start or no more nodes to process.

getMacroContext

public Processor getMacroContext()
Gets the processing context for the last macro that was stepped into.

Returns:
the processing context, or null if no macro was stepped into

hasNext

public boolean hasNext()
Gets whether or not there are any more nodes to process.

Returns:
true if there are more nodes to process, false otherwise

step

public void step()
Moves the processing forward. If in a macro and the last node in that macro was already processed, the step will step out of the macro and back to its parent node, but processing will not move forward in the parent until this function is called again.

Throws:
NoSuchElementException - if there are no more nodes to process

stepToNextLevel

public void stepToNextLevel()
Processes the graph until we reach the next node level.

stepToNode

public boolean stepToNode(OpNode node)
Processes the graph until we hit the specified node. This method will step through the current macro (if one was stepped into), but will not automatically step into macros to find the specified node.

Parameters:
node - the node to stop processing at
Returns:
true if the specified node was found, false otherwise

stepInto

public void stepInto()
Step into a macro. If the current node isn't a macro, this function behaves exactly like step().

Throws:
NoSuchElementException - if no more nodes to process

stepOutOf

public void stepOutOf()
Steps out of the current macro, if one was previously stepped into. Any unprocessed nodes in the macro will be processed. If there was no macro being processed by this processing context, this function does nothing.

stepAll

public void stepAll()
Processes the graph to completion.
